page.title: 11Farming: Beef Cattle
page.content: Berwick Hill Farm has a breeding herd of 75 cows, their calves and their replacement heifers. The cows are Friesian Hereford crosses and cross Charollais animals. Charollais bulls are used to provide calves fit for fattening on either grass or by intensive methods. The cows calve down in July and August and remain at grass until October. The whole herd is housed during the winter months, the cows in a semi-covered yard, and the calves having access to covered accommodation, where they are fed hay and cake. The cows winter on treated straw and rolled barley. In Spring the herd is put out to grass again.The calves are weaned in May, replacement heifers are selected and retained on the farm. The rest are sold to be fattened elsewhere.
